Ru_trainchinese:
qiāng: (сущ) копье; пистолет, ружье, винтовка; предмет в форме пистолета
qiāng: (графема) писать экзамен за кого-то другого, подменять экзаменующегося
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the tree (木) from the storehouse (倉) is made into a spear
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Storehouses for trees in Brazil take things very seriously.  They protect the premises with guns.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " wood " to " cang ", it is represented as a long rod, pointed stabbing weapon. "Shuowen": "Xiaoye. From the wood, Cangsheng. One said: The gun is the sound." "Shuowen Tongxun Dingsheng": "The weapon of the Xiaoren. "Cangjie Pian" The gun is also the sharp one at both ends of the wood. ""Mozi·Beichengmen": "Twenty guns, two steps in Zhou."

The " pile " used for digging soil and weeding is also called " gun ". "Mandarin ‧ Qiyu": "When the rain is here, I use his spear, mow, stubborn, and 镈, to engage in the field with time." Wei Zhao's note: "Spear, pile.

The tea tree shoots are also called " guns " because of their shape resembling a stabbing weapon with a long pointed tip. Song Wang Dechen's "The History of Poetry and Poetry": "Fujians say that the tea buds are not displayed as guns, but when they are displayed as flags, to the second flag they are old."

Guns and modern weapons, pistols, rifles, etc., have a caliber less than 2 cm. Weapons that fire bullets are also called " guns ." An instrument or tool that resembles a gun in performance or shape can also be called a " gun ". Such as: welding torch, electron gun, smoke gun.
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " wood " and " cang ", it is expressed as a long rod, pointed stabbing weapon.
humanum_full_description:
從「木」，「倉」聲，表示為長杆、有尖頭的刺擊武器。《說文》：「歫也。从木，倉聲。一曰：槍欀也。」《說文通訓定聲》：「歫人之械也。《倉頡篇》槍，謂木兩頭銳者也。」《墨子‧備城門》：「槍二十枚，周置二步中。」

　　掘土除草的農具「樁」也稱為「槍」。《國語‧齊語》：「時雨既至，挾其槍、刈、耨、鎛，以旦暮從事於田野。」韋昭注：「槍，樁也。」

　　茶樹嫩芽因其形狀類似長杆尖頭的刺擊武器，也稱為「槍」。宋王得臣《麈史‧詩話》：「閩人謂茶芽未展為槍，展則為旗，至二旗則老矣。」

　　火槍及近代武器手槍、步槍等口徑在2厘米以下，發射子彈的武器也稱為「槍」。性能或形狀像槍的器械或工具也可稱「槍」。如：焊槍、電子槍、煙槍。
humanum_short_description: 從「木」，「倉」聲，表示為長杆、有尖頭的刺擊武器。

Chinese: When you want a new gun you go to a storehouse and try shooting them at wood logs in the nearby forest.  
Meaning: gun
Hanzi: 枪
Story: Storehouses for trees in Brazil take things very seriously. They protect the premises with guns.
Kind: traditional

從「 木 」，「 倉 」聲，表示為長杆、有尖頭的刺擊武器。《說文》：「歫也。从木，倉聲。一曰：槍欀也。」《說文通訓定聲》：「歫人之械也。《倉頡篇》槍，謂木兩頭銳者也。」《墨子‧備城門》：「槍二十枚，周置二步中。」 掘土除草的農具「 樁 」也稱為「 槍 」。《國語‧齊語》：「時雨既至，挾其槍、刈、耨、鎛，以旦暮從事於田野。」韋昭注：「槍，樁也。」 茶樹嫩芽因其形狀類似長杆尖頭的刺擊武器，也稱為「 槍 」。宋王得臣《麈史‧詩話》：「閩人謂茶芽未展為槍，展則為旗，至二旗則老矣。」 火槍及近代武器手槍、步槍等口徑在2厘米以下，發射子彈的武器也稱為「 槍 」。性能或形狀像槍的器械或工具也可稱「 槍 」。如：焊槍、電子槍、煙槍。
From the sound of " wood" to " cang", it is represented as a long rod, pointed stabbing weapon. "Shuowen": "Xiaoye. From the wood, Cangsheng. One said: The gun is the sound." "Shuowen Tongxun Dingsheng": "The weapon of the Xiaoren. "Cangjie Pian" The gun is also the sharp one at both ends of the wood. ""Mozi·Beichengmen": "Twenty guns, two steps in Zhou." The " pile" used for digging soil and weeding is also called " gun". "Mandarin ‧ Qiyu": "When the rain is here, I use his spear, mow, stubborn, and 镈, to engage in the field with time." Wei Zhao's note: "Spear, pile. The tea tree shoots are also called " guns" because of their shape resembling a stabbing weapon with a long pointed tip. Song Wang Dechen's "The History of Poetry and Poetry": "Fujians say that the tea buds are not displayed as guns, but when they are displayed as flags, to the second flag they are old." Guns and modern weapons, pistols, rifles, etc., have a caliber less than 2 cm. Weapons that fire bullets are also called " guns." An instrument or tool that resembles a gun in performance or shape can also be called a " gun". Such as: welding torch, electron gun, smoke gun.

槍字的基本解释

槍
qiāng
见“枪”。

槍字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qiāng］
［《廣韻》七羊切，平陽，清。］
“枪1”的繁体字。
(1)武器名。长杆一端有尖头的刺击武器。
(2)武器名。火铳，火枪。装火药和铁砂的旧式枪。
(3)武器名。口径在2厘米以下，发射子弹的武器。
(4)喻指武装力量。
(5)性能或形状像枪的器械或工具。
(6)桩。掘土除草的农具。
(7)削尖的竹木片。供编篱用。参见“槍纍”。
(8)特指茶树初萌的嫩芽。
(9)突；冲撞。
(10)见“槍替”。
(11)姓。汉代有枪传。
[②]［chēng］
［《廣韻》楚庚切，平庚，初。］
“枪2”的繁体字。
星名。参见“槍2星”、“槍2棓”。

槍字的康熙字典解释

【辰集中】【木字部】　槍； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页546第09
【唐韻】七羊切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】千羊切，?音鏘。【說文】距也。【周禮·秋官·職金】國有大故，而用金石，則掌其令。【註】用金石者，作槍雷椎椁之屬。【揚雄·長楊賦】木雍槍纍，以爲儲胥。　又【玉篇】木兩頭銳也。【類篇】剡木傷盜曰槍。　又曰器也。見槈字註。　又抵也。【前漢·路溫舒傳】見獄吏，則頭槍地。　又【前漢·天文志】紫宮左之星曰天槍。　又姓。【姓苑】漢槍傳。　又【集韻】【韻會】楚耕切【正韻】抽庚切，?音崢。【爾雅·釋天】彗星爲欃槍。亦叶音鏘。【宋·謝瞻·張子房詩】婉婉幙中畫，輝輝天業昌。鴻門銷薄蝕，垓下隕欃槍。

考證：〔【周禮·秋官·職舍】國有大故，而用金石，則掌其令。〕　謹照原文職舍改職金。

gun
Basic explanation of words
gun
qiāng
See "gun".
gun
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qiāng］
["Guangyun" seven sheep cut, Pingyang, Qing. ]
Traditional characters for "枪1".
(1) Weapon name. A pointed stabbing weapon at one end of the long rod.
(2) Weapon name. Fire guns, muskets. Old-style gun with gunpowder and iron sand.
(3) Weapon name. A weapon with a caliber below 2 cm that fires bullets.
(4) Metaphor refers to the armed forces.
(5) Apparatus or tools that resemble a gun in performance or shape.
(6) Pile. Farm tools for digging and weeding.
(7) Sharpened bamboo chips. For weaving fences. See "Gun Tired".
(8) Especially refers to the buds of tea plants.
(9) Sudden; collision.
(10) See "gun replacement".
(11) Last name. There are guns in the Han Dynasty.
[②] [chēng]
["Guang Yun" Chu Gengqie, Ping Geng, Chu. ]
Traditional characters for "枪2".
Star name. See "Gun 2 Star", "Gun 2 Challenge".
gun

[Note] Those who use gold and stone are regarded as the genus of the spear and thunder cone. 【Yang Xiong·Chang Yang Fu】Mu Yong was tired of spears, thought to save Xu.　[Jade Chapter] The two ends of the wood are also sharp. 【Classes】The thief said the gun was wounded by the wood.　Yes again.
